Package io.github.nickm980.smallville

Class SmallvilleClient

java.lang.Object
io.github.nickm980.smallville.SmallvilleClient
public class SmallvilleClient extends Object
Represents a client for interacting with the Smallville application backend. Must start the smallville server before the client can start.

  • Method Details

    • create

      public static SmallvilleClient create(AgentHandlerCallback stateHandler)
      Creates a new instance of the SmallvilleClient on the default host http://localhost:8080/. Intended to make getting started easier by provided default functionality. Must still start the server to use Smallville.
      Parameters:
      stateHandler - The callback handler for agent state updates.
      Returns:
      The created SmallvilleClient() instance.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if stateHandler is null or empty.

    • create

      public static SmallvilleClient create(String host, AgentHandlerCallback stateHandler)
      Creates a new instance of the SmallvilleClient.
      Parameters:
      host - The host URL of the Smallville application backend.
      stateHandler - The callback handler for agent state updates.
      Returns:
      The created SmallvilleClient() instance.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the host or stateHandler is null or empty.

    • createAgent

      public boolean createAgent(String name, List<String> memories, String location, String activity)
      Adds a new agent to the simulation. Cannot have two agents with the same name.
      Parameters:
      name - The unique name of the agent.
      memories - The list of initial memories associated with the agent.
      location - The initial location of the agent.
      activity - The initial activity of the agent.
      Returns:
      True if the agent creation is successful (the agent was created because the data is valid and agents of the same name do not exist), false otherwise.

    • createObject

      public boolean createObject(String parent, String name, ObjectState state)
      Creates a new leaf location
      Parameters:
      parent - The parent of the object.
      name - The unique name of the object.
      state - The state of the object such as "empty" or "on"
      Returns:
      True if the object creation is successful, false otherwise.

    • createLocation

      public boolean createLocation(String name)
      Creates a new location
      Parameters:
      name - The unique name of the location.
      Returns:
      True if the location creation is successful, false otherwise.

    • ask

      public String ask(String name, String question)
      Asks a question to the specified agent as the role of an interviewer. No memories will be created as a result of this question because the operation is stateless. To add the result to the memory stream use addObservation(String, String, boolean)
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the agent.
      question - The question to ask.
      Returns:
      The answer received from the agent.

    • updateState

      public void updateState()
      Updates the state of the simulation. When the game updates the user provided state handler function will be called with the updated dataThis occurs in several main steps:

      1) Save observation from the game into the agent's memory stream

      2) Retrieve relevant memories based on observations

      3a) Create or change plans if necessary and save them in memory stream

      3b) Reflect on the retrieved memories if the importance of the memories is greater than a predefined value and save the results back into the memory stream. This is to help the agent generalize memories.

      4) Act on the retrieved memories and new plans

    • addObservation

      public boolean addObservation(String name, String observation, boolean reactable)
      Adds an observation to the specified agent in the Smallville application.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the agent.
      observation - The observation to add.
      reactable - Indicates if the observation is reactable. Reactable observations will re-prompt agents to change their current activity and possibly their plans before updateState() is called.
      Returns:
      True if the observation addition is successful, false otherwise.
